story.storykicker: New policies foe education will be adapted only after an approval from all states in the country.
story.storybody:
Union Human Resource Development minister, Smriti Irani on Friday, i.e. June 3, said that any final decision on the New Education Policy of the country will be taken only after an approval from all states.

(Read: Private coaching centres continue to function between 8 am and 3 pm in defiance of DC's order )

Background:

  • Union HRD minister Smriti Irani said, "The education policy is not a property of an individual. We need to share it with the states and get their approval before making it public."
  • Subramanium had said that he will make the new policy public if the government did not do so
  • Subramanium, as the head of the committee of five members, had made the policy and submitted it to the authority in May

(Read: Reforms in education policy: Class 5 students can now be detained for poor performance )

About the Education Policy:

  • According to Mrs Irani, this is the first time that an educational policy had been formed based on the suggestions of students and parents
  • "We leveraged technology and received written suggestions from 1.10 lakh villages, over 5,000 blocks and 20 states," said Irani
  • Apart from adding IIt's, IIM's and IIIT's to the country, Irani also said that the new education policy is to bring out drastic new measures that would work on the mechanism to rank institutes of higher education, to raise the quality of education all over the country
  • Cultural activities and regional crafts will be given importance in abundance in the new policies to be implemented
